list_definition.definition: a small bag carried by women, for personal belongings

list_ex_of_english: On one of the handbags being opened in order to see to whom it belonged, a contraceptive was found in it.
If these searches are to proceed into private homes, into diaries and handbags and other items of a personal nature, there is real cause for concern.
They expect the volume of handbags to eventually represent 20% of their annual sales.
On the whole, it has been felt that handbags are more likely to be left unattended than trousers.
However, one can envisage circumstances in which he may be metaphorically sand-bagged or, perish the thought, "handbagged" into something which may be less advantageous.
Among its product line items there are watches, handbags, jewelry and other durable personal goods.
Confidence, once it has been handbagged, is hard to win back.
I do not know about gentlemen's pockets, but ladies' handbags are extraordinarily weighty nowadays.
